channel.title: Sock Puppets on Tedium: The Dull Side of the Internet.
channel.description: Recent content in Sock Puppets on Tedium: The Dull Side of the Internet.

item.title: All Sock Puppets Go To Heaven
item.description: Today in Tedium: How much was the Silicon Valley bubble responsible for the companies that failed the hardest at the turn of the 21st century? Conversely, how responsible were the basic ideas behind those companies for those failures? Was it really terrible timing, or a stock market that couldn’t support the tech world’s innovation during a hugely creative period? Or did the tech world simply prop up ideas, or at least businesses, that didn’t actually work?
